result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marley Boyce

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marley Boyce appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke appeared by video for Marley Boyce.  Attorney Eric Bashirian appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State complied with Victim Notification. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record, and confirmed by Defense and Defendant. 

STATE FILED AN AMENDED INFORMATION. Defense waived reading of the Amended Information, and temporarily entered a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of Defendant.

ADDITIONALLY, STATE ORALLY AMENDED COUNT 3 TO REMOVE PENALTY ENHANCERS: Habitual Criminality Repeater, Sec. 939.62(1)(b) and Mandatory Minimum - Repeat Firearm Crimes, Sec. 939.6195(2). 

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1 AND AMENDED COUNT 3: 
Defendant changed his plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to the plea, and advised of Constitutional Rights and maximum penalties. Defendant advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found Defendant knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waived all his rights. Parties stipulated to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis for the plea. Court found Defendant GUILTY as charged in the Amended Information, and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. 

AS TO COUNT 2: 
Pursuant to negotiations and on Motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED. 

Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, or body armor. 
Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored.

Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing hearing, Branch 46. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference. 
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 11:00 am. 

FILED: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum, and Elements of the Offense/Jury Instructions.

-received, filed, and distributed. Defense received a copy. 

AS TO COUNT 1: On Motion of the State, Court ordered charge COUNT 1 AMENDED TO OPERATING A MOTOR VEHICLE WITHOUT OWNER'S CONSENT, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes Section(s) 943.23(2), 939.50(3)(h), a Class H Felony.   

AS TO COUNT 2 AND COUNT 3: Remains as originally charged.
-received and filed.
-received and filed.

Case in Court for Final PreTrial. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. Defense received an offer from the State and requested time to review with Defendant. Court granted request. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 
Final PreTrial scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

Defense contacted the Court and State via email regarding Final PreTrial. 
Defendant IN CUSTODY @ Wisconsin Secure Program Facility. 
NEW DATE: October 14 2022 at 10:45 am.
Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in Court, Defendant Marley Boyce not in Court, in custody.  Eric Bashirian appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Defense appeared via Zoom Video Conference. State appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Defendant's appearance waived for today's hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received discovery material and an offer from the State. Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46.

Final PreTrial scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 11:00 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.
Jury Trial scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Marley Boyce in court with Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke; both appear by video.  Defendant Marley Boyce in custody.  Annie Louk appeared  in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 18CF5170. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective A. Bradford.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
